intro: Stemmodontia buphthalmoides, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features a basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves that are often tinged with purple. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, typical of the Ranunculaceae family. Its stem is stout and often branched, supporting the floral display. The plant is adapted to arid conditions, with a deep root system that allows it to thrive in sandy soils.
